root:
Warden The Warden wields a family heirloom. It is an executioner sword made from a rare metal. He also dons flexible armor distinctly crafted for northern territory.
No. His task is elsewhere. Mine is here. No. His task is elsewhere. Mine is here.
The Warden of the North has aged since his peak soldiering years, but he remains a stalwart commander. He inspires bannermen to focus and brave soul-shattering conditions while he directs their attacks.
The Warden has many stories to tell at the campfire, and each one has a lesson for the listener. He also talks of tactical strikes and keeps people vigilant with warnings of Winter.
We're all coming home. Don't worry, lads. We're all coming home. Don't worry, lads.
Honor Execution Sentence Call Direwolf Leadership Free Action Not Guarding Bleed Enhancement
Indictment Execution Sentence Call Direwolf Rally Bannermen Honor Prayer Leadership Move Indictment Execution Sentence Call Direwolf Rally Bannermen Honor Prayer Leadership
Rusty Soldier's Greatsword Soldier's Greatsword Valyrian Greatsword Royal Valyrian Greatsword "Ancestral Greatsword" Warden's Greatsword Old Brigandine Cured Brigandine Enhanced Brigandine Northern Lord's Armor "Northern Bulwark" Warden's Brigandine
Others:
One step closer to home.
Wound Care Encourage Pep Talk War Stories Pointy End Winter is Coming Experienced Commander
King's Final Letter Walking Stick Weirwood Branch Ice Dawn Ned's Head Weathered Sigil War-Bred Direwolf Hand of the King The Lineages and Histories of the Great Houses of the Seven Kingdoms Offensive Skill Direwolf Pelt Armor "You think my life is some precious thing to me?"
It'll heal. Don't mind the scars. They become another story... eventually. My friend died to a wound like this-- difference was he was poisoned by his wife. Don't let this wound tarnish your loyalty to our Hamlet's lord. More will come if we're to save it.
This is another war. It'll pass. Serve your lord. Life or death-- we will do our duty. Do your duty.
If they're well armored, aim for joins and exposures. Stand with me. I'll defend you, my friend. You'll be fine with me-- I earned this blade.
I followed my childhood friend to war. Twice. Without doubts. Without second thoughts. My father and brother were burned alive in the King's Court. I led soldiers to war shortly after. ... I married during the war. It was necessary to bring a country into our Alliance against the Mad-King. The Lion betrayed the Mad-King when he saw we'd win the war. My friend ignored the treachery-- and I never forgave it. Rumors say I killed the Sword of the Morning in single combat. I will say this: he died in duty. We sieged the Seastone Chair from ships and shore. It didn't take long. We fought at the river. My friend slayed the Dragon Prince while I fought in the vanguard.
I don't fight in tournaments. When I fight a man for real, I don't want him to know what I can do. Stick'm with the pointy end? *Chuckles* That's the essence of it. The man who passes the sentence should swing the sword. Otherwise, he forgets what killing is.
Winter is coming. You were born in the long summer. Winter is truly coming. We must protect ourselves. When the snows fall and the white winds blow, the lone wolf dies, but the pack survives.
Strike quickly against this target when I give the signal. When I command, attack here... Save your full strength for my signal.
...
No... Let this veteran rest.
The man who passed the sentence swung the sword. The King in the North! I'll send you for the breast-plate stretcher! I can still thrust a weapon better than YOU! Bend the knee.
A leader of men appears at the edge of town. The Warden pledges his service to the Lord of the Hamlet. An Honorable Man
No-- my children!
That damnable brothel-keeper could strike!
I'm a soldier. I learned how to die long ago.
You've all abandoned your honor!
Damn the throne-- I'm returning home!
Winter has come.
In the sight of gods and men, I confess my treason.
I cannot restore our dead to life. But perhaps I can give them justice.
Afraid-- the only time a man CAN be brave!
Attack the back row and they will rout!
I need no servant to behead my foes for me.
I cannot restore our dead to life. But perhaps I can give them justice.
The North cannot be contained so easily.
We will find justice for our kin.
You have the command-- bring them to justice! Hold fast! In the name of our lord, bring them to justice!
I task you with the duty of winning this battle.
They deserve more than a butcher. End them, then burn the bodies. I have blood of the First Men. The North put their trust in me. I must leave to protect my children! Where are my daughters!? Baelor! The flesh-peddler could strike any moment! Who can I trust in this wicked world? We'll find no honorable men in the south. I'm ready to die. I'm prepared for the end-- should it come. It's inevitable. Where's your honor!? Have you no shame!? You're not suited for this battle! I ought never return to the south! My family doesn't fare well in the south. I make for home at daybreak. My castle is a smoking ruin. They crippled my son! You don't know Winter like we do. I conspired with the King's enemies! I conspired to take the throne for myself! I confess my treason. I... should return home-- to my family. Let me fall back, I must send a raven. I must return and protect my daughters! Don't trust the city watch-- not while he's paying them! He held a knife to my throat. He'll do it again. Retreat! One more scar for a veteran. An honest death for an honest soldier. I was ready to die long ago. Use my sword for the beheading! I must visit the executioner. I broke the law. I'll return to my prison cell. Maybe the Spider will bring me some water? My son's leading an army to us as we speak. I'd rather die here than beyond the Wall. Burn my body after I die. Let me meet my father and brother. I'm not worthy of the honor. I must prepare for my own execution. I... can't recall why I'm here. Cut through them, and let me return home! I will see my children again! I'll return to my castle, and we'll rebuild! I'm done. I'll meet with my son and his army. You have the command-- I'm finished here. End it quick-- I'm ready to go North. I ought to keep watch. After I find my daughters. I must escape! I ought to keep watch. Did you pay these "heroes," or someone more sinister? No, they might stab me in the back. *He shakes his head.* I'm planning my trip home. Last time I did that, someone stabbed me through the leg. Forget me. Escape and live. It's not worth the effort. Regroup. ... it can't work. I'm overdue an execution. Get on with it. I should be in a dungeon cell right now! Throw me in the dungeon where I belong. There he is! I know a rat when I see one. No! I'll handle it. I'll be fine. I'm ready to die. Wha-- you have no right to command me! I was a fool to serve you! All of you-- you have no honor! That won't save my children! I'll make it work! Every man for himself! I... can't. No, it won't help me return home. ... I won't. Let me help you. It won't work. We need new tactics. ... I hope they're all safe. Nights like these in the North foreshadow an attack... ... will I ever return to my wife and children? Who pays you!? The last time I trusted the city watch... ... I trusted him. My mercy killed the king. This is enjoyable! I love to fight! My last team and I won the arena. This team? Couldn't win a fish bowl. Look, just listen to me, and I'll carry you to the top. You all need to do arenas for a year. This is pathetic. Hey, you save some extra food for me? Where's second servings? If I'm going to carry you, I need more food! My mercy killed the king. My best friend-- slain by his own wife. I remember better times. They were all alive... I'm surprised you didn't turn me in. I would turn myself in-- if only to save my children. ... let me die in silence. Right here! I challenge you to a duel! Do it. My friends and family are all dead. It's my turn. *He gestures to his neck.* Here. I did it! TREASON! You work for the Mockingbird! You'll betray us! Honorless fool! You dishonor us with your foolishness! Do your duty! Do it! This soldier's ready. I learned how to die long ago. Let my son wield this sword. I'll bait them with my life. Flee. I'll behead myself! This sword is intended for executions. We'll die. They'll ambush, we can't. This will be my end of my tale. Send news of my death to the North. Not all of us will return home. I'm duty-bound to end this, one way or the other. Let the new Kingsguard take me. It's my time. If I die here, my children have no-one left! My son-- why am I here!? Behind him-- the Mockingbird! They're paid to end us! I'm wasting time here! I should have stayed in the North! A little more. Go on. Finally! Good, we're making progress. Now's my chance to run! I should go-- now! Was it him!? They'll betray us all! Try again. Once more. Try again. Once more. I'll never see my children again if you hit like that. I'm dead at this rate... I expect no honor or valor from you. You'll find no honor with an attack like that. Why must you attack the Kingsguard? Only a fool would attack them. We'll never see home again at this rate! Farewell, brother! We're going to die if you keep missing! Are you the Mockingbird's agent!? Gods, even a low-born cripple could hit them! Even the Old Gods can't save you. I wish I'd have chosen you as my enemy. Your head should be on the chopping block, not mine. You must be their ally. Did the Mockingbird pay you to miss? Run to the maester, quick! You stay-- I'll leave for home! Are you a traitor or not!? I thought you were a traitor! Soldiers are resigned to death. Are you? A good grave for a good soldier. Parry, you green recruit! Dodge, you lot! It's a cover-up! I know you're a traitor! You'll need more to prove your innocence! Now's our chance to run! Quick, let's go! Ditch this one! He's a traitor! Leave this treasonous wretch! Take the warning and stay back. Let them do their duty. We need to move back... This is a bad idea. ... you won't fool me. Traitors-- everywhere! No, I'll die here. No, here suits me. I don't listen to brigands. You've no honor or rank to command me. I'll die here. I'm fine. No, might be poisoned. Could be poisoned. Nothing can save me now. It's beyond time for that. That is meaningless... There is no reason to do that... It won't ease the pain. It can't help. You're no maester! No-- it's a trap! A wiley trap! I'm fine without it. Another scar won't kill me. Help someone else. Trivial. There is only one ending for this. It won't make or break the fight. I don't need that right now. No! Honor compels me in this duel. I'm good for now. This is a terrible time. Why now? My sentence is now. I will endure a bit longer-- for honor! A little pain soothes the soul. Send it to my kin. Keep it for yourself. It's just wasted on me. I'll last. Don't need it. It's a duel!
That was so weak! I must say I am quite disappointed. Get good. Great. Interesting. Compelling. Winterfell! We shouldn't rest here. This place is cursed. There are so many more. Brigands would strike! I know they're coming. They will end us in our sleep. I grew up with soldiers. I learned how to die long ago. I'm ready without it. I'll live. You're all green. It shows. Your best is not good enough. Should have found better companions. I'd rather go home. No, it's time to leave. Give me a moment to recover. This journey will end us. The results will be the same. I feel our end coming. Sleep with two eyes open. We don't need sleep. Flee to the bedcovers! This is a bad idea. That won't help us survive. Gestures of a traitor! It'll kill me! All I need is the battlefield. No, I'd rather a sword. No, you're inept. No, we're better off without you. No. Let me rest a bit. This doesn't change anything. We're just waiting for the headsman's axe. I refuse. It's not for me. Do we really need to eat now? This doesn't taste right. Fighting's all the food I need! I'm good to go, thanks. I'm ready without it. It can always use a bit more salt. I wish we had some chicken. I would love a steak right now. Let's eat later. Eh, it tastes horrible!
-----------------------------------------------------------
